alert.note: Alert for Apple and Lucerne Valleys; Coachella Valley; Orange County Coastal; Orange County Inland; Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino County Mountains; San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire; San Diego County Coastal Areas; San Diego County Deserts; San Diego County Inland Valleys; San Diego County Mountains; San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning; Santa Ana Mountains and Foothills (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 21 at 8:58PM PST until January 22 at 4:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including: All of San Diego and Orange Counties, Inland Empire, Apple and Lucerne Valleys, Coachella Valley, the San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning and the Riverside, Santa Ana, and San Bernardino Mountains. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Periods of heavy rain will result in urban and road flooding in areas with poor drainage. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A moisture laden Pacific storm will move across Southern California Monday. Areas of rain and isolated thunderstorms expected. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
